node.author: t
node.label: Welcome to CompendiumNG (CNG)

node.author: t
node.label: To continue please select one of the following:

node.author: t
node.label: To open a map double click it. Go ahead with this tutorial by double clicking the map node above

node.author: t
node.label: This is the Home Screen for this new project. The home screen is the map that will be opened automatically when you load a new project. From here you can create and open further maps. Generally CNG lets you use nodes which can be linked to organize your ideas, discussions and materials.

node.author: t
node.label: Tutorial

node.author: t
node.label: Learn the Basics:

node.author: t
node.label: Welcome to the CNG Tutorial

node.author: t
node.label: You work with CNG by creating nodes that you can then arrange and connect in any way you like. This way you can create complex maps. Importantly you can use a single node in multiple maps to enable cross referencing (called a transclusion). The type of map and types of nodes you create will depend on how you use compendium. We will come back to this later.

node.author: t
node.label: A node

node.author: t
node.label: Overview of Node Types

node.author: t
node.label: Overview of Node Types

node.author: t
node.label: LISTS also contain other nodes, but display them in a list/table

details.page:

node.author: t
node.label: Make an IDEA into a DECISION node to show commitment (right-click and select 'change type to ...')

details.page: Pressing the 'D' key will create a DECISION icon on the screen where your mouse is located.Pressing the 'D' key will create a DECISION icon on the screen where your mouse is located.

node.author: t
node.label: This is an ISSUE or QUESTION that you are thinking about

details.page: Pressing the 'Q', '?' or 'I' key will create an ISSUE/QUESTION icon on the screen where your mouse is located.

node.author: t
node.label: Use a CON to express a challenging argument

details.page: Pressing the " - " (minus) key will create a CON icon on the screen where your mouse is located.Pressing the " - " (minus) key will create a CON icon on the screen where your mouse is located.

node.author: t
node.label: Use a PRO to express a supporting argument

details.page:
Pressing the '+' key will create a PRO icon on the screen where your mouse is located.

Note: You do NOT have to hold down the SHIFT button while pressing the '+' key. Compendium knows that when you type a '=' you want a '+'.Pressing the '+' key will create a PRO icon on the screen where your mouse is located.

Note: You do NOT have to hold down the SHIFT button while pressing the '+' key. Compendium knows that when you type a '=' you want a '+'.

node.author: t
node.label: Use an ARGUMENT to show support for one idea but challenging another (drag off the plus or minus)

details.page: Pressing the 'U' key will create a ARGUMENT icon on the screen where your mouse is located.Pressing the 'U' key will create a ARGUMENT icon on the screen where your mouse is located.

node.author: t
node.label: This is an IDEA which responds to an Issue. The asterisk shows there is detail text inside the node. Click on it to view.

details.page: Pressing the '!', 'A' or 'P' key will create an IDEA icon on the screen where your mouse is located.Pressing the '!', 'A' or 'P' key will create an IDEA icon on the screen where your mouse is located.

node.author: t
node.label: CNG supports different types of nodes. There are two types of nodes that can contain other nodes: maps and lists:

node.author: t
node.label: MAPS contain other nodes which can be freely arranged

node.author: t
node.label: This is a NOTE for misc. comments

details.page: Pressing the 'N' key will create a NOTE icon on the screen where your mouse is located.

node.author: t
node.label: The default nodes set contained in CNG is designed for the IBIS methodology, which lets you map coversations, decisions and meetings. It distinguishes the following node types:

node.author: t
node.label: What kinds of Reference nodes might one link to? (Double click to open this map)

node.author: t
node.label: Example of using node types for dialog mapping

node.author: t
node.label: In addition to these there are also 'reference' type nodes that you can use to link to websites or documents. Often the most simple way to add a reference is by by simply using drag and drop of external files into CNG.

node.author: t
node.label: You can add details to all your nodes. To see the detail for any node hover your mouse over the * symbol in the upper right corner

node.author: t
node.label: All of these nodes are "embedded" into other views. Hover over the digit in the lower right to view the navigation menu which will take you to these other views

node.author: t
node.label: Navigating Maps

node.author: t
node.label: Great you managed to navigate here. Alternatively to pushing the canvas you can also use your mouse wheel for navigation.

node.author: t
node.label: to move left right: hold SHIFT while using the mouse wheel

node.author: t
node.label: to move up and down: Use your mouse wheel

node.author: t
node.label: Sometimes you like to see more or less nodes on screen. You can use the zoom function to achieve this:

node.author: t
node.label: In CNG your nodes and links are arranged on a big surface. You can think of this surface as a canvas similar to the canvas you would use for drawing. To use CNG efficiently It is important you learn how to navigate this canvas. Obviously you can use the scroll bars to the left and right of the screen. However, generally it is more more efficient if you simply right click anywhere onto the canvas without any content and then push the canvas around to the direction you like to go.

node.author: t
node.label: Tutorial: Navigating Maps

node.author: t
node.label: to continue scroll up ...

node.author: t
node.label: Try navigating the canvas by following this link to the other end.

node.label: Two basic units exist in CNG: Nodes and Links

node.label: Creating Nodes

node.author: t
node.label: Creating Nodes:

link.author: t
link.label: (right click + drag to make links between nodes

link.author: t
link.label: to zoome in and out hold down the CTRL button while using the mouse wheel

link.author: t
link.label: simply create new nodes and maps by dragging different node types from the Node Cration Toolbar into the map area

link.author: t
link.label: right click at an empty space and select 'Create Node'

link.author: t
link.label: Use keyboard shortcuts to create nodes by pressing the key associated with a node type, e.g. 'M' for a map node
